title: Stephen S. Chang Award for Lipid or Flavor Science
text:
The Stephen S. Chang Award for Lipid or Flavor Science has been awarded every year since 1993. It is awarded to a member of the <a href="Institute%20of%20Food%20Technologists">Institute of Food Technologists</a> (IFT) who has made significant contributions to <a href="lipid">lipid</a> or <a href="flavor">flavor</a> science. This award is named for <a href="Stephen%20S.%20Chang">Stephen S. Chang</a> (1918-1996), a <a href="China">Chinese</a>-born <a href="food%20science">food scientist</a> who later became a <a href="food%20science">food science</a> professor at <a href="Rutgers%20University">Rutgers University</a> in <a href="New%20Brunswick%2C%20New%20Jersey">New Brunswick, New Jersey</a> specializing in lipid and flavor research. It was the second IFT award to be named for a living person.
Award winners receive a <a href="USD">USD</a> 3000 <a href="honorarium">honorarium</a> and a <a href="Steuben%20crystal">Steuben crystal</a> from the Stephen S. Chang Endowment Fund supported by the <a href="Taiwan%20Food%20Industries%20%28SSC%29">Taiwan Food Industries (SSC)</a>.
